definition: to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: But there's not much risk of interlopers.
sentences.chinese: 但是并没有多少来自闯入者的竞争威胁。

sentences.english: But as they do that, they are bumping into the reality of the world.
sentences.chinese: 但是随着他们那样做，他们正在闯入现实世界。

sentences.english: In Watergate, the break-in didn't affect the outcome of the election.
sentences.chinese: 在水门事件中，闯入行为并未影响选举的结果。

sentences.english: Break into Riddler's secret hideout and exact your revenge.
sentences.chinese: 闯入谜语人的隐秘藏身所，实现你的复仇。

sentences.english: The intruder broke down the door.
Police said it was a wild cat that strayed into people's homes.
sentences.chinese: 警方表示，其实这是一只野猫误闯入民宅。

sentences.english: He invented an electronic instrument that gives an alarm when an intruder comes in.
sentences.chinese: 他发明的电子仪器能在有人闯入时发出警报声。

sentences.english: It was in 1937 when Japanese soldiers broke into the city Beiping.
sentences.chinese: 日本鬼子闯入北平城是在一九三七年。

sentences.english: He walked to the door and opened it, prepared to accost an intruder with righteous indignation.
sentences.chinese: 他走上前去开门，义愤填膺地想向闯入者发难。

sentences.english: Then came the day that the bandits attacked.
sentences.chinese: 就这样直到强盗闯入的那一天。

sentences.english: The invaders brazened their way into our motherland.
sentences.chinese: 侵略者肆无忌惮地闯入了我们祖国。

sentences.english: The thief bursted the house last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚小偷闯入那间屋子。

sentences.english: Shen Han forces already open a gap, broke into the island.
sentences.chinese: 沈晗的部队已经打开一个缺口，闯入小岛。

sentences.english: The cold in the air means so recklessly into my body.
sentences.chinese: 空气中的冷意就这样肆意闯入了我的体内。

sentences.english: The thelloef intruded into the house with caution and dissimulation.
sentences.chinese: 小偷儿小心掩饰着闯入屋内。

sentences.english: The moment someone broke into the factory, a burglar alarm rang in the police station.
sentences.chinese: 一有人闯入工厰，警察局的防盗报警就会响起。

definition: to dip a finger (idiom); fig. to get one's finger in the pie/to get a share of the action/abbr. for 染指於鼎|染指于鼎
lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
to halt/to stop/to go no farther
to set foot on (a foreign land etc)/to tread/(fig.) to enter (a new sphere)
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to return in low spirits following a defeat or failure to achieve one's ambitions (idiom)
